text:
- I wanna demonstrate the
new checksum capabilities.

And so, I'm gonna upload two
new objects to my bucket.

Specifically, two new
photos of my dog, Sky.

And I'm gonna do that using
the new checksum capabilities.
And I'm gonna verify that my objects
where uploaded using checksums.
So to do that,
I'm gonna click on 'Upload'.
I'm gonna drag in a photo.
And I'm gonna scroll down to 'Properties'
for that object.

And I can see that I
got a new option here.
'Additional Checksums'.

And me, being the
durability-obsessed engineer
that I am,
I have a catalog of checksums that I keep
for my dog photos.
And so,
I'm gonna copy in a checksum
that S3 will use to verify,

to make sure that the
object data isn't changed
during that upload.

I'm gonna copy in, actually
the wrong value here, first.

To see what happens if I give
a checksum that won't match.
And when I click on 'Upload',
you can see that very quickly,

it's telling me that
the pre-calculated value
that I provided for this object,

doesn't match the data
that it was calculated
on the S3 server.
Great.
So now, I'll copy in the correct checksum.
Paste that in here.
And I'll upload the object.
So now, as it's uploading the object,

it's storing that checksum,
along with the object data.
And it's also validating the object.
And checksumming that on our server.
And it will only store that data
if those checksums match.
Great.
So, that uploaded successfully.
The next object, I'm gonna upload.
But this time,

I'm not gonna specify
a pre-calculated value.
Instead, I'll let the AWS Console

upload that checksum, or
calculate that checksum,
while it's uploading it.
So I'll go to 'Properties' again.
And I'll turn on 'Additional Checksums,'
and I'll select a SHA-256 checksum here.

And I'll leave this
pre-calculated value blank.
And I'll upload the object.

Okay, so now the Console's
computing the checksum
as it's uploading the data.

And that checksum will
be stored with the object
during its entire lifespan in S3.

If I take a look at this
object in the Console,
and I scroll down,
I can see that there's a new box here,
called 'Additional Checksums'.
And I can see that this checksum value

was the one that was
calculated during the upload.
And if I compare that against my catalog,
I can see that's indeed the checksum value
that I expected.
And so if I go back,
and I look at that object in the Console,

I can see that my object
was uploaded successfully.
